title: Manufacture - Terrorvision, Voice of World Control, and an EP
description:
Manufacture

Main members: Brian Bothwell, Perry Geyer

Both of their albums, bonus tracks, and an EP, all on the Nettwerk label.

"The world is tired of political fanaticism."

(This is the same as what I uploaded before, plus added artwork.  The other one was accidentally deleted by the staff here.)

******************************

Terrorvision, originally released in 1988, although this is from the 1990 US CD release.

Slugger        
As The End Draws Near  
Passion For The Future        
Bond Street Station        
Little Caesar        
Terrorvision        
Obsolete        
Ballet Mechanique        
Armed Forces        
American Embassey

CD Bonus tracks:   
Armed Forces (Bombing Mix)        
As The End Draws Near (Ext)        
Terrorvision (2 East Meets West)  

Vocals by Sarah McLachlan on "As The End Draws Near"
Vocals by Mel Blanc on "Little Caesar"

(That's how they spelled "embassy" on the insert!)

******************************

Voice of World Control - 1990

World Control
A Measured Response
Running Mad
My Destiny
New Decisions
Many Machines
Drug Squad
Pain Amplifier
The Bogey
Control Yourself
Emergency Broadcast

Vocals on "Running Mad " by Anneli Drecker  
Vocals on "New Decisions" and "Control Yourself" by Nigel Butler

******************************

Control Yourself/World Control  EP - 1990

Control Yourself   (7" Vox)   
A Measured Response   (12" Instant Addiction Edit)   
World Control   (12" Electronic Surveillance Edit) 
Many Machines   (12" Techno Terrorist Edit) 

******************************

I can't tell much difference between the two versions of "Control Yourself," but really, I dislike that song so much, I can't force myself to listen to it enough to see if there is any difference, so I just included them both.  But that's one of their few clunkers.  In case you were not aware, there are also a few demos you can listen to on their MySpace page.

Format is .wma at a variable bit rate.
